body_html:
@mcarilli Nothing really. But once PT1 is publicly released, it’d be great if Apex can update to using get_backend. :)

@mcarilli Nothing really. But once PT1 is publicly released, it’d be great
if Apex can update to using get_backend. :)
…
On Fri, Sep 14, 2018 at 18:59 mcarilli ***@***.***> wrote:
 @mcarilli <https://github.com/mcarilli> After this patch I am able to run
 apex imagenet code directly with c10d.

 Great, thanks! Are there any remaining changes I need to implement on my
 end to make sure Apex is backward/forward compatible?

body:
@mcarilli Nothing really. But once PT1 is publicly released, it’d be great
if Apex can update to using get_backend. :)

On Fri, Sep 14, 2018 at 18:59 mcarilli <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @mcarilli <https://github.com/mcarilli> After this patch I am able to run
> apex imagenet code directly with c10d.
>
> Great, thanks! Are there any remaining changes I need to implement on my
> end to make sure Apex is backward/forward compatible?
>
> —

> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
